dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A listener, Mark from Austin, writes in: "With Disney+ and Apple TV+, is Netflix finally going to feel the heat?"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A listener, Mark from Austin, writes in: With Disney+ and Apple T V+, is Netflix finally going to feel the heat?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. And you know, Reed Hastings actually addressed that directly in the investor letter. He said he doesn't anticipate these new entrants will materially affect their growth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. And you know, Reed Hastings actually addressed that directly in the investor letter. He said he doesn't anticipate these new entrants will materially affect their growth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We dont anticipate that these new entrants will materially affect our growth because the transition from linear to on-demand entertainment is so massive and because of the differing nature of our content offerings, Hastings wrote Tuesday in an investor letter that accompanied Netflix's first quarter earnings release.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and the numbers kind of back that up—they added a record 9.8 million subscribers last quarter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and the numbers kind of back that up-they added a record nine point eight million subscribers last quarter.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix reported record 9.6 million subscribers in the quarter that ended in March.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and get this—8 million of those came from outside the U.S. That's huge. But uh, they did forecast slower growth for the next quarter, which made the stock drop a bit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and get thisminus eight million of those came from outside the U.S. That's huge. But uh, they did forecast slower growth for the next quarter, which made the stock drop a bit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Much of that growth7.86 million subscriberscame outside the U.S. The company forecast slower growth in the second quarter, prompting the stock to drop nearly $5 a share in after-hours trading to $354.60.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm, they mentioned the recent price increase in the U.S. is moderating growth there. But still, revenue was up 22% to $4.5 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhm, they mentioned the recent price increase in the U.S. is moderating growth there. But still, revenue was up twenty two percent to four point five dollars billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This guidance takes into account the impact Netflix's rate increase in the U.S., which is moderating growth in the spring quarter, the company said. Revenue for the first quarter rose 22% to $4.5 billion, compared with a year earlier.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they beat earnings estimates too—76 cents a share versus the expected 57. Not too shabby.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they beat earnings estimates toominus seventy six cents a share versus the expected fifty seven. Not too shabby.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix reported a net income of 76 cents a share, exceeding the estimates of Wall Street analysts, who had forecast per-share earnings of 57 cents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: No kidding. And Hastings made a good point about the overall market—Netflix is only like 10% of TV time in the U.S., so there's still tons of room.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No kidding. And Hastings made a good point about the overall market-Netflix is only like ten percent of T V time in the U.S., so there's still tons of room.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix represents only about 10% of total TV usage in the U.S., its most mature market, Hastings noted, and there's more room to grow around the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He said all these services will benefit as people move from linear TV to on-demand. It's not a zero-sum game, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. He said all these services will benefit as people move from linear T V to on-demand. It's not a zero-sum game, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hastings said all direct-to-consumers services will benefit, as consumers migrate away from passive TV viewing to entertainment delivered online and on-demand.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And they're leaning hard into original content—like The Umbrella Academy, watched by 45 million households in its first month.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And they're leaning hard into original content-like The Umbrella Academy, watched by forty five million households in its first month.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Umbrella Academy, a series based on the comic book by Gerard Way and Gabriel Bá, which has been watched in 45 million households in its first four weeks on service, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. And Triple Frontier, with Ben Affleck, hit 52 million homes. They're really betting on exclusives.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And Triple Frontier, with Ben Affleck, hit fifty two million homes. They're really betting on exclusives.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Viewers in 52 million homes grabbed the popcorn to watch the action/heist movie Triple Frontier, starring Ben Affleck and directed by J.C. Chandor.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's not just U.S. stuff either—they're adapting shows like Nailed It! for Mexico, France, other markets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's not just U.S. stuff either-they're adapting shows like Nailed It! for Mexico, France, other markets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is adapting its lighthearted cooking competition Nailed It! for Mexico, France, Germany and Spain.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And that Korean series Kingdom—zombies in historical Korea—was a massive hit there and globally. Ted Sarandos said their top 10 shows are all Netflix originals now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that Korean series Kingdom-zombies in historical Korea-was a massive hit there and globally. Ted Sarandos said their top ten shows are all Netflix originals now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This period piece with zombies is our most successful season one show in Korea to date and has also been watched by millions of members outside of Korea, Hastings said. The top 10 show are all Netflix original brands, said Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So it sounds like their strategy is working, even with Disney and Apple joining the party.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it sounds like their strategy is working, even with Disney and Apple joining the party.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Seems that way. Hastings called them 'world-class brands,' but he's not exactly losing sleep.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seems that way. Hastings called them 'world-class brands,' but he's not exactly losing sleep.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The big dog of Internet TV acknowledged the new competitors as world-class consumer brands whose forthcoming services would be a boon to consumers and content creators alike.
